I hope you get some relief from the redness and from your worries!

(I don't have a cancer diagnosis--just dealing with breast issues but I had some imaging done a few months after stopping breastfeeding and even then the doctors said some of what they were seeing could be remnants of lactation). Posts.Title: Experiencing Symptoms at 30 rnyoung85 rnyoung85

Posts.Content: Dec 27, 2015 06:54AM sarahr30 wrote: Why not request some imaging on the affected breast? An ultrasound or mammo? Maybe that will put your fears to rest or help identify another issue that could be causing the skin problem if it isn't fungal and stemming from something internal. I will say that my friend had a stubborn fungal skin rash and she had to try different anti-fungals before it went away. Still, i'd request an ultrasound because you never know and you are also feeling very anxious. The fear and anxiety aren't good for you either. Lily55--I doubt she is wishing breast cancer on herself. She is just concerned and scared.
Posts.Title: I'm back again Lils23 bride

Posts.Content: Oct 8, 2015 05:40AM sarahr30 wrote: Hi Sam, I am experiencing something similar--I have been having sharp and stinging pain in left breast, armpit and collarbone for several months now. I had an ultrasound in June that showed a milldly complicated 6mm cyst (some internal echoes). Ultrasound was repeated with mammo because my OB-GYN felt thickening in the left breast. Mammo was clear except for benign calcifications and ultrasound still showed cyst. She referred me to a breast surgeon to ease my mind. He examined me, viewed my scans, and has put me on 6 month monitoring because he wants to see if the cyst changes so I go back in February for ultrasound. Sorry that was long-winded--just wanted to give you background. Anyway, I would say go to the breast surgeon, hear what he/she has to say. I wouldn't settle for less than some additional monitoring--an ultrasound in a few months at least--unless you feel comfortable what what the doctor says. If the symptoms persist then SOMETHING is going on and it is unlikely to be cancer but it's still important to find out what's happening. Is the cyst palpable? Mine isn't so the surgeon isn't convinced it is the cause of my pain and recommended things like a change of bra and vitamin E. I don't wear an underwire so I don't think that is it. What kind of pain are you having? It could always be hormonal as well. Increased estrogen levels can cause breast and ovarian cysts--I have both as well. I hope you feel better and get some answers!

Posts.Title: Had ultrasound this morning.... pink028 sarahr30

Posts.Content: Nov 24, 2015 10:26AM sarahr30 wrote: Pink028, I'm so glad you got benign results though I know it can be frustrating not having explanations for some symptoms. I am a birads 2 also and I have dilated ducts. I think that they typically occur with age but tend to present more in postmenopausal women (someone please correct me if I am wrong). I breastfed for like 3 years so the BS said in my case they are probably "remnants" of that. I have heard that duct ectasia (dilated ducts) can cause the breasts to invert, nipple discharge and other symptoms and since the indent seems to be in the same spot as the duct it seems like you probably have a plausible explanation for it. I can't remember if you had any pain as well? I've had a lot of pain in the breast with the dilated ducts but radiologist said the ducts wouldn't cause that kind of pain and it is likely the cyst I have, fibrocystic changes, or something else. I'm glad to hear that nothing serious was found!!

Posts.Content: Nov 17, 2015 05:00PM - edited Nov 17, 2015 05:00PM by sarahr30 rnyoung85, I can definitely relate. I've been lurking around here for the past few months because that pain you describe started for me outside of my left breast and into my armpit and collarbone (though sometimes it is like a sharp stinging). It's interesting because i've also had hair thinning for a while now, fatigue and mood swings (i'm 33). I have fibrocystic breasts also and had two ultrasounds and a mammo in the past few months but all they show are a cyst and duct widening in my left breast (I breastfed in the last year). I've had all kinds of blood tests and thyroid is checking out fine as well (I even had an ultrasound). Have you had any testing? I think you definitely should at least get checked out by an OB-GYN, who would likely order an ultrasound. If you haven't been breastfeeding then i'd definitely want to find out what that drainage is. Pain can also signal a problem so it is worth getting checked!

Posts.Title: Technician says she couldn't see anything- am I 'clear'? Qwertyuiop2015 Qwertyuiop2015

Posts.Content: Nov 19, 2015 08:59AM sarahr30 wrote: I wouldn't say you are in the clear, no. Can you get a copy of the report? From my experience with ultrasounds there are standard angles taken of both breasts and then the tech will take some additional photos of areas that potentially have abnormalities. I'm sure the techs have some idea of what they are looking at but they aren't trained doctors so the doctor's final word is the one you want. My ultrasounds have about 20 images or so (no malignancies--just cysts and duct widening).
Posts.Title: Technician says she couldn't see anything- am I 'clear'? Qwertyuiop2015 Qwertyuiop2015

Posts.Content: Dec 20, 2015 09:38AM sarahr30 wrote: Weneke, For what it's worth, I am almost 34 and have fibrocystic breasts and am experiencing pain on one side that goes to armpit, shoulder and collarbone. Imaging hasn't shown any kind of malignancy thankfully so I guess it is possible to experience fibrocystic changes more on one side. I have another scan in February so i'm curious to see if there have been any changes. I also have one bigger breast (though it is the one without pain). I do think you should still get checked out to be safe. It does sound like you are experiencing hormonal changes but i'd still go to the doctor and request at least an ultrasound. I hope you get some answers and that your discomfort goes away!

Posts.Title: Anyone get back and chest pain with fibrocystic? Jesus_girl CancerSurvivors

Posts.Content: sarahr30 wrote: Hello all! I had an estrogen metabolism blood test because my regular progesterone and estrogen blood tests showed I was estrogen dominant. I was reading through the lab report of the metabolism test and it showed I have high (out of range) levels of 16alpha-Hydroxyestrone and low (in range) levels of 2-Hydroxyestrone . My ratio of 2:16alpha-Hydroxyestrone is out of range low. I read that these kinds of results can be associated with breast cancer and i've been having some issues with my left breast. Anyone have any insights into how accurately these tests correlate with breast cancer risk? I'm curious if anyone on here with breast cancer has had these tests? I'm taking DIM and increased omegas and Vitamin D to hopefully shift these numbers. Thanks :) Log in to post a reply
